metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9806 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the netlink_dump function in net/netlink/af_netlink.c in the Linux kernel before 4.6.3 allows local users to cause a denial of service (double free) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted application that makes sendmsg system calls, leading to a free operation associated with a new dump that started earlier than anticipated. Baozeng Ding discovered a double free in the netlink_dump() function in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9806` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-107-generic - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-lowlatency - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-3.13.0-107-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-107.154
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-107-generic - 3.13.0-107.154
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-79-generic - 3.19.0-79.87~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-79-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-79.87~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-107.154').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.19.0-79.87~14.04.1').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-107.154').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-34.53~14.04.1').
